title: Whose bright idea was it to make AP items so stupidly expensive compared to AD

replies.body: The guy who got bored of farmed APs instaclearing waves from ridiculous range with like 2 abilities.
You mean Zed's Q?
No he means lux e, ori e-q, ziggs q

Which cost mana (and quite a hefty amount in many cases) and arent ''instaclearing'' unless they rush high amounts of AP, right?

If they rush AP, they are squishy and go OoM fast.

If they rush Armor/HP, they have no damage and go OoM fast anyways.

If they rush a mana engine, they have low damage and are squishy.

Meanwhile, Zed rushes {{item:3155}} and counterbuilt his AP enemy completly., while not losing much because it builds into something cheap, efficient and easy to build.

I clicked on this thread and 30 seconds later I already got cancer from all the bias LOL.

Zed is strong, has good wave clear and Hexdrinker/Maw is a really strong item as well, Im not denying that.
But cmon, AD assassins generally want to rush both armor pen and CDR, Hexdrinker doesnt give any of that. AD mids build Hexdrinker because otherwise they would just get insta oneshot by that Annie or Ahri or whatever. They need it.

Maw might even need some small nerfs, but lets not exaggerate like that.

Zed's range is longer than Ori, does more initial damage, and gets reduced less than Ori.

So if he means Ori, he means Zed even more.

Okay no what? It doesn't get reduced less then Ori, Zeds Q does more initial damage *Early* , and does LESS damage to multiple targets since its reduced by 60% for all other targets hit and any of shurkiens are also reduced by 60%.

I suggest reading tooltips. Zed's Q deals a minimum of 60% damage, Ori's deals a minimum of 40% damage.

So if you have a 7 target wave and hit every target, Ori deals 4.9x her tooltip damage in total. Zed deals 4.6 of his tooltip damage in total. 

But since Zed's tooltip damage has drastically higher base damage and scaling, Zed does far more damage with waveclear than Ori. 

Because math.
Well Oris Q has better scaling, half the cooldown if she maxes it and higher range unless Zed uses his mobility spell... Which he probably shouldnt.

Ori's Q range is 850. Zed's Q range is 900.

Ori's Q scales at 50% AP. Zed's Q scales at 100% bonus AD, increased to 105/110/115/120/125 passively with W rank.

If Zed uses WQ, the range is 1600.
I meant instaclearing a wave. That's 3 abilities and probably a few autos fo' Zed.

Which none of the champions you listed can do without rushing full AP, anyways.

While Zed uses energy and his Q is on lower or equal cd that most of those.

Meanwhile other AD mids face a similar or greater struggle to their AP counter parts.

Zed isn't the only AD mid, he's strong for sure, but he's not the default.

There is Talon, who is supposed to not have waveclear... and Yasuo? Which has equally unfair waveclear to Zed since he is resourceless and low cd. Riskier, yes, but only from jungle ganks because WindWall.

Talon, not resourceless.

Yasuo, extremely weak until he's gotten his Shiv.

Neither come close to the early game of Zed.

The biggest issue is the advantage assassins naturally have against most mages.  There are some like {{champion:8}} {{champion:50}} {{champion:63}} that can sort of cheat their way around this, but otherwise mages just don't have the strongest laning phases, many don't really start to shine until team fights start.

That is just NOT true.

Hexdrinker gives 20 AD and 35 MR, Seeker's armguard gives you 35 AP and 45 armor when stacked and is 80g cheaper than hex.
Why are you crying about this again? It looks like the AP champion gets more stats for their gold.
Add up shield, do actual calculations comparing resistance+shield with pure resistance, come back. Seeker's is thrash and you need to stack it, and it build into trashy item.

The gold value of Seeker's is 1661 when you stack it and there's no way to play around it.
The gold Value of Hexrinker is 1330 without the shield, the shield will give you ~150 hp earlygame when it matters so that's 400g, 1730g in total.

Hexdrinker is 100g more expensive and gives you 69g in stats more earlygame, if you play around the shield it's even worse. That makes Hexdrinker 130% gold efficient while Seeker's is at 138%. 

Even with the hex shield Seeker's armguard is more gold efficient once stacked and it only takes 2.5 mins to fully stack it.

Idk what kind of drugs you're on to call Zhonya's a trashy item, it's one of the best items in the game. That active is completely game changing if you use it correctly.
Brilliant. Now calculate effective HP. Be sure to include base MR of a champion. Gold value means nothing if wielder of Hexdrinker is still way harder to kill.

Why would I do that? Gold value is everything that matters when you're complaining about AP items being too expensive or AD items being too cheap. How those items scale off of base champion stats is completely irrelevant.

Not to mention that Seeker's gives you 978g in AP while Hexdrinker only gives you 720g in AD, Hexdrinker is a more defence-oriented item.

Yes it is relevant, resistances give increasing returns when coupled with HP/shields and vice versa. Raw armor may be expensive but it doesn't mean it's not nearly worthless for a mage.

> Not to mention that Seeker's gives you 978g in AP while Hexdrinker only gives you 720g in AD, Hexdrinker is a more defence-oriented item.

That's when fully stacked.
Oh no not like 4 and a half waves. Damn, I have to wait like 2.5 minutes for my item to be really cost effective. Must mean RoA is a garbage item, right?
Excuse me Zed, please let me farm these next 4.5 waves without harassing me or killing me so my item can be worth something. Don't punish me for taking a stacking item before its stacked please.

Dodge shurikens and he won't harass you (or if he uses shurikens to push you CAN harass him back with no fighting back). Also at level 6 if you buy this item (which is when you should) Zed cannot 100-0 you on his own with at most a hexdrinker. Doesn't matter what mid you are you should have both flash and your other DEFENSIVE summoner up still since he shouldn't be able to blow them before level 6 so his kill potential goes down again.

Everyone complains about altering play against Zed by taking Exh or Heal/Barrier but taking ignite is not only a death sentence, but you will not be able to kill him with it anyway. You actually have MORE kill potential with exhaust since he WILL still try to kill you and fall flat on his face and probably die by overcommiting. This is especially true when you are probably pushing about 75 armor as well.

> Dodge shurikens and he won't harass you

dodge the skillshot has always been the best form of counterplay and at no point has ever been frustrating to play against {{champion:53}} {{champion:76}} etc....

> You actually have MORE kill potential with exhaust since he WILL still try to kill you and fall flat on his face and probably die by overcommiting. 

Assuming the zed is bad isn't a comment on balance.  

> This is especially true when you are probably pushing about 75 armor as well.

Where on earth are you getting 75 armor on a mage?

Um...what kind of a mage doesn't run all Armor runes? 36.27 extra starting armor. I mean sure even with that Orianna only starts with 53.31 armor. But... I'm sure most mages start with closer to Cho'gaths 28.8...wait...that's still only like 65. Oh well obviously mages all take tank masteries also. SEE!

Edit: Oh at level 6 well see then Orianna has around 32 base armor so add the 36...close enough to 75. 

As an aside:

Ori, Azir, Ryze, Zyra, and TF don't have 75 base armor even at level 18.
Seekers gives 30-45 and most Mages have ATLEAST 30+ armor at level 6, so yes, you are pushing 75 armor at this point. This is not even considering your choice of Seals.

Champions like Ziggs, Lux, Heimerdinger and Syndra have CC and range that make them much harder to kill.

Except those champions usually build Zhonya's 6th item, mostly because it's less crappy alternative to Rylais as high AP item for them, mages with high self-peel and range are not primary Armguard users, stop using them as example.

Only Heimer builds it out of champions you mentioned, but that's because of his very specific playstyle.

Er...because Zhonya's is frustrating and has been a staple in the game for four years now? Riot can't shake up the meta if Zhonya's is always being rushed successfully. It promotes high risk play with little chance to punish when used correctly, meaning mid laners who can't rush it are always worse off when it's good.
Doesn't change how itemization for mages sucks, sry. Those mages who need armor don't have any semi-good option.

Wasn't there an AP + Armor + MR item on Dominion and Twisted Treeline?  Wish they'd port that over and change its tenacity stat to something else for SR. That'd help at least a little bit as a start, maybe.

As much as I adore the item, it'd end up being a must buy on any AP even without the tenacity. 50 AR/MR along with the AP even if it's only 50 is insane.

I'd be down for 40/30 AR/MR and 70 AP though.
Moonflair Spellblade, yes.

Yes, there are scarce options to itemize for both offense and defense. Them's the breaks when you have range, CC and AOE.

he means as in gives both armor and ap. you listed tank items, not mage items. I'm not saying you're wrong, just you were listing items from an entirely different class. can anyone build it? yes, I commonly pick up portal as my final item as ahri for a reason. does it mean that mages have semi-decent items to take for first items that have armor? no, they have zero decent options unless they use that 1 certain item that will on most mages just simply make them take another 2 seconds to kill you.

You're not taking into account that by the time seekers is stacked, an enemy AD has plenty of armor pen and you also have 0 mana regen unless you deviate and delay your zhonyas (which in most cases is bad bad BAD)

It takes 2.5 minutes to fully stack it, you only need 5 waves(which will give you 32 cs), less if you take chickens, then you only need 2 mins. Are you really saying the AD champion is going to get hexdrinker then recall after only 2 minutes of laning just to buy some Arpen?

Why would AD champion who has huge advantage due to Hexdrinker being so much better than non-stacked Seeker's(1730 gold value as you said, vs 1035 in non-effective stats) allow you to take 100% CS? Why do we assume game has place in bronze?

No, we're assuming you picked an actually viable champion and have a way to waveclear with a spell from over 900 range, making it pretty safe. Mana isn't a problem because your jungler will give you blue around lvl 7 and you should recall for Seeker's+boots around lvl 6, waveclearing before a siege wave so you don't lose any cs.

If I have ability to take 100% CS safely, why would I need rush defensive item in the first place? Seeker's and Zhonya's being overpriced crap is the reason why champions in questions aren't viable...

To get Zhonya's faster so you can actually contribute in the midgame transition and roaming and not have to be scared shitless every time your opponent leaves lane?

Not being able to 1v1 means you can't safely follow roams since you have to take the long route through your own jungle.
You can achieve that with vision. Again, why we assume bronze game?

Obviously you've never played in a decent rating, otherwise you'd know that vision goes to the laner with better all-in. If the enemy laner stabs a pink in the pixel brush and you can't 1v1 him you'll never be able to get any vision in that area and you'll never be able to kill that pink.

The best you can do in that situation is secure vision top-side but that matters much less than bot-side vision.
Reporting this user for trolling

And Zhonya's helps with that exactly how? Any half-decent Maw user will still punish you severely for getting this pink if you rush Zhonyas, cutting of your roam anyways. If I have 900 range safe and reliable waveclear I'm still much better using my mana to push him into his tower making him choose between defending river pink and CS.

Only hey, overpriced stasis is still not what I need to do that. There's a reason why only strong roamers with decent winrate are Ahri and TF.

He mainly plays Ryze and Riven, and the other champs he plays don't build Zhonyas. That's why he can't understand you. Which is sad because he's S5 Challenger and is currently D1. It's not like this concept is something hard to understand.

You make very valid points. I agree with you on all of them.
